title: Herbert Bradley
text:
Herbert Bradley (1888 – 21 June 1918) was an English professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="outside%20left">outside left</a> who played in the <a href="the%20Football%20League">Football League</a> for <a href="Bury%20F.C.">Bury</a>, <a href="Notts%20County%20F.C.">Notts County</a> and <a href="Preston%20North%20End%20F.C.">Preston North End</a>.
Personal life.
Bradley served as a <a href="Gunner%20%28rank%29">gunner</a> in the <a href="Royal%20Garrison%20Artillery">Royal Garrison Artillery</a> during the <a href="First%20World%20War">First World War</a>. On 5 April 1918, while acting as a forward <a href="artillery%20observer">artillery observer</a>, he was taken <a href="Prisoner%20of%20war">prisoner</a> by <a href="German%20Empire">German</a> forces and taken to <a href="Limburg%20an%20der%20Lahn">Limburg an der Lahn</a> prisoner of war camp. He died of <a href="dysentery">dysentery</a> in the camp on 21 June 1918 and was buried in <a href="Avesnes-sur-Helpe">Avesnes-sur-Helpe</a> Communal Cemetery, France.
